headline.print_headline: U.S. Troops Sent to Syria to Aid Forces Fighting ISIS
headline.main: Obama Sends Special Operations Forces to Help Fight ISIS in Syria

byline.contributor: Peter Baker and Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and David E. Sanger from Vienna.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER, HELENE COOPER and DAVID E. SANGER

snippet: The president announced on Friday that several dozen troops would be deployed to Kurdish-controlled territory for the first open-ended mission by American ground forces in Syria.
abstract: Pres Obama announces he has ordered dozens of Special Operations troops into Syria to advise local forces battling Islamic State; deployment is small in scale, but important because Obama has long vowed never to send ground troops to Syria.
lead_paragraph: The president announced on Friday that several dozen troops would be deployed to Kurdish-controlled territory for the first open-ended mission by American ground forces in Syria.
